security.forgive-unexpected-decrease-during-tende: Y If set to N, removing items during the tendering stages after Finish And Pay is pressed will cause an unexpected decrease exception before the balance is paid
security.attract-quiet-mode: Y attract-quiet-mode, if set to Y, causes wt added to the scale during attract to be ignored. If the wt is still present when the transaction is started, it will cause an unexpected increase exception to be generated. This option only applies to a Scan&Bag system. If set on a TAB system it will be ignored.

smart-scale.slow-wt-conclusion-in-expecting-timer: 750 Number of milliseconds to delay reporting an incorrect weight change from the Security scale - when a weight change is expected
smart-scale.slow-wt-conclusion-in-attract-timer: 3000 Number of milliseconds to delay reporting an unexpected weight from the Security scale - when there is a weight change at Attract screen
smart-scale.slow-wt-conclusion-in-not-expecting-time: 1500 Number of milliseconds to delay reporting an unexpected weight from the Security scale - when a weight change is not expected
smart-scale.slow-wt-conclusion-timer-belt: 1000 Number of milliseconds to delay reporting an unexpected or incorrect weight change from the Security scale on Takeaway Belt
smart-scale.watch-dog-timer: 5000 Number of milliseconds to allow SlowWeightConclTimer to be restarted with 'noise' from Security scale
smart-scale.watch-dog-timer-belt: 1500 Number of milliseconds to allow SlowWeightConclTimer to be restarted with 'noise' from Security scale on Takeaway Belt
smart-scale.zero-expected-wt-timer: 4500 When WLDB expected weight=0, wait this long on Bag Item screen to ensure they do not bag anything.
smart-scale.zero-expected-wt-timer-belt: 3000 When WLDB expected weight=0, wait this long on Bag Item screen to ensure they do not bag anything on Takeaway Belt.
smart-scale.end-of-transaction-tolerance: 100 At End of Transaction, final weight can vary from beginning "Virtual-Zero" weight by this amount. 1000 = one lb
smart-scale.LRW-LGW-tolerance: 80 Tolerance within which LGW or LRW can vary without causing Security Violation screen
smart-scale.acceptable-delta-weight: 60 Tolerance within which the weight can vary without causing an unexpected increase/decrease
smart-scale.security-scale-scanner-scale-tolerance: 80 Tolerance within which Security Scale weight & Scanner Scale weight can vary without causing Sec Violation screen
smart-scale.default-bagging-required: Y Default bagging required for items without exception data. Also known as the Weight Required flag.
smart-scale.default-substitution-check-required: Y Default substitution check required for items without exception data. Also known as the Substitution Check flag.
smart-scale.allow-hold-wt: Y Use SmartScale's HoldWeight property, Y/N. HoldWeight=Y allows for rapid scan & bag.
smart-scale.default-heavy-wt-limit: 5000 Weights over this amount, apply the DefaultHeavyWtTol value
smart-scale.default-medium-wt-limit: 2000 Weights between this amount and DefaultHeavyWtLimit apply the DefaultMedTol value
smart-scale.default-heavy-wt-tolerance: 200 Tolerance within which heavy item weights can vary from the WLDB entry. Heavy=anything over the DefaultHeavyWtLimit setting. 1000 = one lb
smart-scale.default-medium-wt-tolerance: 200 Tolerance within which medium item weights can vary from WLDB entries. Medium=anything between DefaultMedWtLimit & DefaultHeavyWtLimit settings. 1000 = one lb
smart-scale.default-light-wt-tolerance: 200 Tolerance within which light item weights can vary from the WLDB entry. Light=anything below DefaultMedWtLimit setting. 1000 = one lb
smart-scale.std-dev-max-tolerance: 2000 Maximum value that the Standard Deviation Tolerance calculation cannot exceed. 1000 = one lb
smart-scale.smm-wt-min-tolerance: 50 when adding exception data using Security Maintenance Mode, if changing the default tolerance, it must be at or above this minimum tolerance setting
smart-scale.smm-wt-max-tolerance: 500 when adding exception data using Security Maintenance Mode, if changing the default tolerance, it must be at or below this maximum tolerance setting
smart-scale.auto-learn-zero-wt: N Currently option is not used in any release of FastLane RFC 203307 default is False
smart-scale.minimum-wt: 30 Smallest amount of weight that Smart scale can read
